item.description:
It's time once again for an episode of retro entertainment. Pre Gaga, pre 8-track, pre light bulb, pre United States of America...all the way back to 1742 when George Frederick Handel premiered one of classical music's enduring oratorios "The Messiah".

OK, fine! I know we can't go back in time (and I don't have a wig like this guy) but, we can go see a live performance at the Tremont Temple and be jealous of Georgie's wig.

Performance starts at 4:00 pm. I'll be there at 3:30. YOU NEED TO BE THERE BY 3:45. If you get there late, find a seat anywhere and look for us afterward. 

The performance is about 1 hour. Afterwards, we'll head out of some holiday merriment at one of the local establishments.

 

How to find the group

- Show up on time or early

- Keep your own RSVP up to date so I know who to look for

- I'll pick a row right of the center aisle about 8 rows from the front

- I'll be wearing a black coat and a dark red tie

- Look at all my profile photos so you know what I look like.

- Here is my cell just in case 617.230.7732 - text don't call. My phone goes off when the music starts.

-  If you don't see us before, look for us after at the back of the church.
item.name: Handel's "The Messiah" - Live Performance
